This issue is not there in V2 UI Service.

Here is the behavior definition and Metadata extension screenshots.

//strict;
with draft;

define behavior for ZI_SCHOOL alias schooldetails

draft table zschool_det_d

lock master total etag lastchangeddate
authorization master ( instance )
etag master locallastchangeddate
{
  create;
  update;
  delete;

  draft action Activate optimized;
  draft action Discard;
  draft action Edit;

entry.title: Extensibility Assistant for Key Users: The extensibility expert right next to you
entry.content:
Extensibility Assistant for Key Users: The extensibility expert right next to you

Have you ever been in a situation

  • where you had to create or maintain a key user custom field or create some key user custom logic but wondered which business context, which OData service, which SOAP service, or in general which object you must extend out of the thousands of potential candidates?
  • or where you must figure out which CDS view you should choose as value help provider for your key user custom field out of the thousands of options?
  • or where you know the UI or API service to which you need to add an extension field, but you have no idea which business context or data source needs to be extended?

If your answer is yes, then this blog post is just for you. In this blog, you’ll meet the GenAI-driven Extensibility Assistant, which helps you to master such challenges. Starting with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release, the extensibility assistant is available in the Custom Fields Fiori app and in the Custom Logic Fiori app.

You’ll learn how to make the extensibility assistant available in your system and for your user and how to use it.

How to make the extensibility assistant available in your system and for your user

The extensibility assistant belongs to the feature set of Joule for Developers (J4D) for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. The first step you need to take to make the extensibility assistant available in a system is to “activate” J4D for the system. How this can be done is described in SAP Note 3571857. You can find more information regarding J4D in general (also regarding the licensing) here: https://www.sap.com/documents/2025/02/b4f714de-f57e-0010-bca6-c68f7e60039b.html

Please note that the GenAI-driven extensibility assistant is only available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and only in systems where development is supported:

  • In 3-system landscapes, this is the development system

Once J4D is activated for your system, you need to assign the business catalog SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC to your user. Please note that you need to use client 100, as the key user extensibility apps are only available there.

You can assign the business catalog in various ways:

  1. copy the extensibility template business role SAP_BR_EXTENSIBILITY_SPEC to your own role and assign this copied role to your user. You can refer to Maintain Business Roles for further details on how to maintain business roles
  2. assign the business catalog SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC to another custom business role that you assign to your user

As soon as the business catalog SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC is assigned to your user, the button “Open Assistant” will be active in the Custom Logic and the Custom Fields Fiori app (see screenshots below).

Open Assistant button in Custom Fields and Custom Logic Fiori app

If it turns out that though you followed all the steps described above  still the "Open Assistant" button does not occur please create a customer ticket on application component BC-SRV-APS-EXT-FLD.

How to use the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields Fiori app.

When you click “Open Assistant” in the Custom Fields Fiori app, the extensibility assistant pops up (see screenshot below):

Initial screen of the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields Fiori app

You can now enter your question or your request in the text box located under the “Your Question” label.

You’ll notice a question mark icon next to the “Your Question” label. Clicking the question mark, a popup appears explaining you how to interact with the extensibility assistant, providing you recommendations when it comes to how to formulate your questions, and showing you a set of example questions (see screenshot below):

Explanation popup of the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields Fiori app

To understand in detail how to interact with the extensibility assistant, let’s have a look at a concrete example. Let’s assume that you were told to create a custom field which should capture an UPS tracking number of parcels belonging to specific sales orders. The field should be included in the OData API for Customer Return documents, as this information is essential for communication with another company.
In general, let’s say that you know the Custom Fields Fiori app, and you know how to create a custom field (by pressing the + button on the upper left corner of the Custom Fields app).
What you’ll most likely not know is which business context you have to choose out of the more than 500 available ones. You most likely also won’t know the exact name of the OData API in which you should enable the field.

That is where the extensibility assistant comes in handy. The scenario mentioned above usually consists of the following steps:

1. You enter your question or your request into the question text box. In this case, the text we enter is “Create a field UPSTrackingNumber and enable it for the customer return OData API”. As soon as you’ve entered the text and pressed the return button (or clicked on the arrow button on the right), the assistant’s answer is shown in the “Assistant Response” text box. It might be for example “I found multiple business contexts related to "customer return". Please choose one of the following options:”. Please note that on the lower right corner of the “Assistant Response” text box, there is a link to “References”. Opening the link, you’ll get a list of SAP documentation links like Fiori Apps Library links, Business Accelerator Hub links, and others which have been the knowledge source of the assistant’s answer. You can click on these links to navigate to these documents. Within the “Assistant Proposal” box, there are business contexts shown which are relevant to the context of your question. You can simply choose one of them by pressing the select button on the right side of the respective option (see screenshot below).

Select business context

In our case, the UPSTrackingNumber field belongs to the header of the Sales Order document. We’ll choose the business context SD_SALESDOC with the description “Sales: Sales Document”.
Note that the extensibility assistant shows a relevance score telling you how relevant the finding is in the context of your question.

2.As soon as you’ve selected the respective business context, the extensibility assistant responds for example “I found multiple OData APIs related to customer return. Please choose one of the following options to enable the custom field:”. You’ll see a list of OData API options from which you can choose. Please note that in this case, a column “Documentation” is shown which allows you to navigate directly to the documentation of the respective OData API to validate whether this is really the API you were looking for (see screenshot below).

Select OData API
In this case, you select the second-best option, as you prefer to use an OData V2 service and not its OData V4 variant.

3. As soon as you’ve selected the OData API option, the extensibility assistant responds for example “The custom field UPSTrackingNumber has been prepared for enabling in the OData API Customer Return (A2X) - V2 (API_CUSTOMER_RETURN_SRV~1). Please make sure to save the changes to make them permanent. If you need any further assistance, feel free to ask!” and proposes an action which you can see in the “Proposed Action” box on the bottom of the extensibility assistant pop-up (see screenshot below).

Proposed Create custom field action

You can now check whether the proposal of the assistant fits your needs and if so, you can simply click “Accept” on the lower right side of the “Proposed Action” box. With that, the data is handed over to the “Create Field” screen of the Custom Fields app (see screenshot below).

Proposal taken over from the extensibility assistant to the “New Field” popup

You can check the data once again and change it if needed. There is always a human in-between, and the extensibility assistant never does something on its own within the system.

Please note that instead of clicking “Accept”, you can continue to chat with the extensibility assistant as it remembers the conversation history. You can, for example, ask the extensibility assistant “Why did you choose a length of 50 for this field” and in the “Assistant Response” the assistant will answer for example “The length of 50 for the custom field UPSTrackingNumber was chosen as a reasonable default to accommodate typical tracking numbers, which can vary in length depending on the carrier and format. If you have specific requirements or need a different length, please let me know, and I can adjust it accordingly!”.
You can also ask the assistant to enable the field in further usages like APIs or SOAP services, or any other available location.

Now, we’ve used the extensibility assistant to master our UPSTrackingNumber challenge, where the assistant helped us to identify the correct business context and propagate the field to the OData API where we needed it to be.
The extensibility assistant supports the following scope:

  • Create Custom Fields: It can create new custom fields in various business contexts.
  • Find Business Contexts: It can help you find the right business context to extend for your custom fields.
  • Find Usages: It can identify where custom fields can be used, such as in UIs, APIs, CDS views, transactions, etc.
  • Enable Usages: It can enable custom fields in identified usages (note that email or form templates are not supported).
  • Find Business Scenarios: It can find business scenarios that involve data flow between different business objects.
  • Find Existing Custom Fields: It can locate existing custom fields in specific business contexts.
  • Find Value Helps: It can find value helps that can be used in custom fields.

How to use the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic Fiori app

Just like in the Custom Fields Fiori app, you can click “Open Assistant” in the Custom Logic Fiori app, which opens the extensibility assistant (see screenshot below):

Initial screen of the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic Fiori app

You can now enter your query to find an extension point in the text box located under the “Your Question” label. As this assistant helps with finding extension points, it’s recommended to enter a query where you outline what you want your implementation to do. As soon as you have formulated your query, you can press enter or click the send button. After a short wait, you are prompted with extension points that fit your query.

Currently, the assistant doesn’t support code generation but can only be used to find the correct extension point for your use case. If you are unsure of what the assistant can do, you can ask “What can you do?” to get an answer. In the following section, you find an example on when and how to use the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic Fiori app.

Imagine you get a new requirement for your bill of materials that you need to implement. If your new requirement is not met, the bill of materials should not be saved. To find the extension point that lets you insert custom checks, you tell the assistant “I want to validate my BOM before it is saved”. Once entered, the assistant prompts you with multiple extension points that might fit your use case (as you can see in the screenshot below):

Extensibility assistant after entering a query

List of references that contain further information and documentation

To choose the right extension point, you can have a look at the extension point’s documentation or further documents about the shown extension points. You can find that information by clicking the “References” link under the assistant’s response. There, you’ll find a list of links that will open the resource in your browser. If you click on the extension point’s documentation, a popup will open containing said documentation. Additionally, you will find the extension point’s documentation by clicking the link “View Documentation” in the table.

Popup with the extension point’s documentation

Once you’ve chosen the right extension point, you can select it from the list and click on “Create Implementation”. This will direct you to the creation wizard (see screenshot below). There, the extension point will already be selected for you. From there, you can create the implementation just like you would normally. If you can’t create an implementation for the selected extension point because it can only be implemented once, you get a warning that tells you which implementation already exists for the selected extension point.

Extension point table after selection

Warning if the extension point is already implemented

Now, we’ve successfully used the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic Fiori app. The extensibility assistant in this app supports the following scope:

  • Find BAdIs: I can find the right BAdI for your custom implementation.

It currently does not support code generation.

Please note that the extensibility assistant is only available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition so far. The intention is to also make it available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, but we can’t share any timeline regarding that yet.

Now, you are done! Congratulations!
You successfully used the extensibility assistant to master challenges with key user custom fields and key user custom logic. You have an idea about the scope of the assistant so that you know what it can do for you, and you know what comes next.

Please note that this blog has been elaborated by a team of experts. I want to thank Yasmina van Rooij (YasminavanRooij), Mathis Neunzig (Mathis Neunzig), Christian Holzer (ChristianHolzer), Yannick Schmitt ( yannickschmitt ) , and Karsten Schaser (Karsten_Schaser) for their extremely helpful contributions.

Feedback, Comments, or Questions:

You’re cordially invited to provide feedback, comments, or questions in the comments section below. Please follow our profiles to get updates when we publish more posts on these topics.
Feel invited to post and answer questions here (https://answers.sap.com/tags/270c4f37-c335-46e1-bfad-a256637d5e26) and read other posts on the topic (https://blogs.sap.com/tags/270c4f37-c335-46e1-bfad-a256637d5e26/).

Other related blog posts:

  1. Key User Custom Fields: When to use what type of code list
  2. Key User Custom Fields: Maximum number of fields and characters
  3. Custom Fields in S/4HANA: How to control field properties like mandatory, read-only, and visibility
  4. SAP S/4HANA Key User Extensibility: Custom field with context-dependent value help
  5. SAP S/4HANA Key User Extensibility powered by Embedded Steampunk: Custom Field with ABAP implemented Value Help

entry.title: SAP BTP ABAP Environment – Pre-Upgrade Option for Release 2511
entry.content:
Overview

Providing a significant number of new features is an important goal of release upgrades to deliver innovations to our customers and partners. There are four major release upgrades per year following a predefined schedule as described in this blog post.

An upgrade is intended as a “no event” for customers and partners. For example, only compatible changes of released objects (APIs) will be delivered. We recommend performing a test of the custom-built productive apps in a test environment for the new release. The complexity of the technical dependencies between the custom-built apps and the underlying environment cannot be tested isolated, only including the ABAP environment on SAP-side. Therefore, we offer you to pre-upgrade selected systems 29 days in advance to test the applications prior to the planned standard-upgrade.   

 

Purpose

This option enables a customer or partner to test the applications they have already developed on top of the new release a couple of days before the standard-upgrade. With SAP BTP ABAP Environment (aka "Steampunk"), we follow the approach of keeping released objects stable and provide all enhancements in a compatible fashion. Early testing is an additional measure to ensure proper software quality and might be used to detect unforeseen regressions. However, this option is not intended to test new features or to consume new features earlier.

 

Approach

The standard-upgrade of all systems to release 2511 is planned for November 15/16.

A customer or partner can nominate one or more already existing systems for the pre-upgrade. A nominated system will be upgraded on October 17 within a planned downtime from 8:00 to 16:00 CET. Depending on the system settings, the actual technical downtime might be only ~20 min within the mentioned timeframe. Please refer to this blog post about the downtime-optimized upgrade. 

We recommend nominating a non-development system, such as a test system. The nomination of a development system is technically also possible, but fixes or other changes must not be imported into another system with a lower release. The nomination of a productive system doesn’t make sense because the purpose of the pre-upgrade is the re-test of the existing application before the productive system gets the new release.

According to the approach explained above, this offer is only relevant for customers or partners having at least two systems.

There might be situations where a correction of custom objects needs to be deployed. Such corrections are possible if the development / correction system is on the older release and is imported into the pre-upgraded system with the higher release.

Except potential fixes, the pre-upgrade is based on the same version as the standard-upgrade. It is planned to perform the pre-upgrade based on hotfix collection 1. The pre-upgrade systems will get the import of hotfix collection 2 after 2 weeks in the middle of the entire pre-upgrade test phase. It is planned to perform the standard-upgrade based on hotfix collection 3 and import this hotfix collection 3 to the pre-upgrade systems on November 15/16 as well.

 

Costs

This offering is optional and free of any additional charges.

 

Planned New Features

The planned new features will be published on the What's New for SAP BTP ABAP Environment on October 17. This list gives you an overview of potential areas for re-testing. The purpose of the pre-upgrade is not to consume these features before the standard-upgrade, because the documentation on help.sap.com will be delivered later before the standard-upgrade. It would also not be possible to transport code of such an adoption, because subsequent systems are not yet on the new release during the pre-upgrade phase.

Independent of the upgrades of the SAP BTP ABAP Environment, we recommend developing automated tests for the custom-built apps to detect regressions early on and without manual effort for re-testing. Such automated tests are perfectly suited to be run in the pre-upgrade test phase.

 

Time Schedule

The following figure summarizes the general approach:

 

Milestones for release 2511:

  • September 16: Nomination of system(s) is possible in the Landscape Portal
  • October 17: Announcement of the planned new features
  • October 13: Pre-upgrade systems are known
  • October 17: Pre-upgrade (with hotfix collection 1)
  • November 1/2: Import of hotfix collection 2 into pre-upgrade systems
  • November 12: Potential decision to postpone the upgrade
  • November 15/16: Standard-upgrade (with hotfix collection 3)

 

System Nomination

To nominate a system, please register the system(s) by October 13 (EOB) latest by using the Landscape Portal. You can find further information about Accessing the Landscape Portal and about Register Systems for Pre-Upgrade. Please do not create customer tickets for system nomination like in previous pre-upgrades.

With such a nomination, the customer agrees to an extraordinary planned maintenance on October 17 (see above).

 

Report an Issue

Issues should be reported as part of the regression test phase by October 31 (EOB) to allow for a sufficient time frame for issue analysis and potential corrections on SAP-side.

Please create a customer ticket by using component BC-CP-ABA.

If a detected issue is likely to endanger the productive use after the standard-upgrade, you should use ticket priority very high despite the fact that the pre-upgrade system is not a productive system.

 

Exceptional Process in Case of Unresolved Priority Very High Issues

In case of the aligned decision on Wednesday, November 12 (based on unresolved priority very high tickets) to postpone the upgrade, a dedicated mitigation process needs to be started together with the respective customer or partner, with the following boundary conditions:

  • Resolving the open priority very high issues remains the highest priority for both, SAP and the customer or partner, as it is also the prerequisite for the upgrade.
  • According to the estimated issue resolution, catching up the upgrade needs to be planned.
  • The upgrade leads to a business downtime of 6 – 8 hours.
  • The upgrade must be scheduled within 7 calendar days the latest after fixing all remaining open priority very high issues.
  • We will not provide any fixes for the old release after the original date of the standard-upgrade to the new release.

In case business-critical issues are detected after the upgrade:

  • Issues need to be reported as priority very high issues and will be processed accordingly.
  • Going back to the release before upgrade is not an option. Therefore, resolving the issues in the new release with the appropriate priority is the required approach.

 

Summary

We recommend performing regression tests in pre-upgraded test systems to avoid day-1 impacts of productive custom apps after the standard-upgrade.

entry.title: Re: Material price change error in MSC2N t-code .
entry.content:
This error typically occurs when the material is batch-managed and uses automatic batch valuation. The valuation type is derived from the batch itself. The system interprets a change in classification as a valuation-relevant change, which would affect pricing or valuation data.

In your case the material 910992 is activated with automatic batch valuation. Changing the characteristic Z023_TRANS_2_HEXENAL may trigger a valuation update. However, since the batch has already been used in transactions (e.g., goods movements, accounting entries), price changes are locked to preserve consistency. SAP prevents valuation changes mid-period if actual data has already been posted for that batch/material combination.

Below are some workaround options

  • If the characteristic is valuation-relevant, SAP treats changes as price-impacting. You can check this in transaction CT04 for the characteristic → see if “Valuation-relevant” is flagged. If flagged, consider removing that flag (requires careful impact analysis).
  • If Material Ledger is active, price changes are tightly controlled. You can only change valuation-relevant data before any postings in the period.
  • If the change is essential and cannot be made to the existing batch, consider creating a new batch with the correct characteristic value.

Have a look at SAP note 958105 which explains error handling in valuation type changes

entry.title: Re: How to use SWFVISU to open SAP GUI transaction.
entry.content:
Hi,

By default “Object Visualization” in My Inbox uses Business Client/WebGUI. To open a Fiori app instead you must configure Intent-Based Navigation in the backend.

Steps:

  1. In SWFVISU find your Task ID.

  2. Change Visualization Type to Intent-Based Navigation.

  3. Fill the Visualization params:
     • Semantic Object – e.g. PurchaseOrder
     • Action – e.g. display
     • System Alias – your front-end server alias.

  4. In the parameter table, map workflow context keys to the app’s parameters (e.g. PurchaseOrder=<PO_NUMBER>).

  5. Make sure the Fiori app is active in /UI2/FLPD_CUST and its OData service in /IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE.

  6. Clear cache (/UI2/INVALIDATE_GLOBAL_CACHES) and test from My Inbox.

Once this is set up, clicking the work item launches the Fiori app directly instead of WebGUI.

entry.title: Re: Sales based contract difference variable amount post...
entry.content:
Yes quite possible to achieve your requirement. SAP RE-FX under IFRS 16 does support sales-based lease contracts with valuation. To make this work as described, your system must have:

  • a valuation rule that includes only the fixed rent condition.
  • a condition group that separates valuation-relevant (fixed rent) from non-valuation-relevant (sales-based rent).
  • sales-based condition set up to post as a separate expense when actual sales exceed the fixed threshold.
  • monthly actual sales data posted to trigger variable rent calculation.

entry.title: Re: Traceability Log validity details
entry.content:
Traceability logs are stored only for thirty days. If you need to consult a traceability log at a later time, download it to your hard drive or store it in a remote folder location.

If you want to make sure that a traceability log is generated for each job run, for example to allow for seamless monitoring or to facilitate auditability, you can force generate traceability logs by configuring the data mapping definition as follows.

Force Generate Traceability Logs
The Generate Traceability Log: For Each Job Run option is especially useful when traceability logs are stored on remote folder locations. For more information, see

 Configure Destinations for Remotely Stored Folders or CSV Files

entry.title: Re: Document type MK not allowed with doc. category F (Pl...
entry.content:
When you reference a contract in a PO item, SAP automatically switches the PO document type to match the contract type. In your case, the contract is likely a value contract (MK). Value contracts are associated with document category F. However, your PO document type NB is for standard POs which conflicts with the contract reference. So when you enter the contract reference, SAP switches the PO type to MK but then throws the error - "Document type MK not allowed with doc. category F". This means either the document type MK is not configured properly for category F, or you’re trying to use a standard PO type (NB) with a value contract, which isn’t allowed.

Below are the options which you can try

Instead of NB, use a PO document type that is configured for document category F and allows referencing value contracts.

If the contract is a value contract (MK), you must use a release order type that supports it. If you intended to use a quantity contract (WK), recreate the contract accordingly.

entry.title: Re: Project Kernseife - improving the measurement of Clean Core in ABAP
entry.content:
Hi @insungbang,

Thanks a lot for your question.

Partner files:
While the standard check (Note 3565942) is referring to the "standard" classification for classic and not-recommended APIs. For SAP content, it is stored in the file objectClassifications_SAP.json or see here in Cloudification Repository. Partners can create their own "classic API" classification and then you can upload the file as well through the SYCM_API_CLASSIFICATAION_MANAGR.

Kernseife Classification:
To not re-invent the wheel, we aligned with the classification approach technically. By this, we can re-use the same mechanism to upload a classification through our own ZKNSF_CLASSIFICATION_MANAGR.
But let me be clear, we use the same mechanism, but it is intended to upload you CUSTOM classification consumed by the Kernseife ATC Check. So the file containing e.g. the information, that contains all the ratings for Kernseife (e.g. BF1 for all classic APIs, but also for your individual adjustments, like "/SCWM/CL_RF*" in the example above) is uploaded like this to the system.

Hope this helps!

entry.title: Re: Can I deliver a custom theme to all subscribers of my...
entry.content:
I can provide a update on using a custom theme within a launchpad module (tested with build workzone instance - documentation based on old portal service).

Advantage: Provider Account Theme can be used in Subscribed Applications, without transporting/creation of themes in Subscriber Account (used via URL)

In a Multitenant Scenario (Should also work single tenant, little adjustments necessary there - but approuter required)

  1. Create Custom Theme in your Multitenant Provider Account
  2. Create UI Theme Designer Instance (technical name: theming - plan: standard)
  3. Create Service Key for that UI Theme Designer Instance
  4. Go to Subscriber Account
  5. Create a destination for example: theming-service
    TypeHTTP
    Proxy TypeInternet
    URLfrom Service Key (endpoints.runtime) for example: https://theming-runtime.cfapps.<cflandscape>.hana.ondemand.com
    AuthenticationOAuth2ClientCredentials
    Client IDfrom Service Key (clientid)
    Client Secret from Service Key (clientsecret)
    Token Service URLfrom Service Key (uaa.url) but append "/oauth/token" for example:
    https://<subaccount>.authentication.<cflandscape>.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token
    Token Service URL TypeDedicated
  6. Configuration in xs-app.json of application router. Routes need to be added:
    This config will redirect theme request to your provider subaccount
{
    "source": "^/themes$", 
    "target": "/themeroot/v1", 
    "destination": "theming-service"
},
{ 
    "source": "^/themes/(.*)$",
    "target": "/themeroot/v1/$1", 
    "destination": "theming-service"
},
{
      "source": "^/comsapuitheming.runtime/(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "destination": "theming-service"
}​

7.  Usage in LaunpadModule or directly in index.html(when approuter points directly to index.html of application)

When using in Launchpad Module it's important to use ui5LibraryUrl instead of ui5VersionNumber, otherwise it will not work! Site Settings documentation: Configuring Site Settings | SAP Help Portal

Relevant for setting the theme is: sap-ui-theme=<custom-theme-id>@/themes Reference: Setting Themes - Documentation - Demo Kit - SAPUI5 SDK

  • Example for Launchpad Module: https://<subscription-app-router-url>/cp.portal/site?sap-ui-theme=<your-custom-theme-id>@/themes#Shell-home
  • Standalone/direct access via index.html: https://<subscription-app-router-url>/<appid(fetchedfromManifestJson)/index.html?sap-ui-theme=<your-custom-theme-id>@/themes

entry.title: Re: Crystal Reports 2008: Cannot use linked parameter for...
entry.content: Thank you for your response. Your statement is correct: a single parameter maintains the same value for all records. However, this appears to be a misunderstanding of my implementation strategy. My goal is not to sort by the parameter's constant value itself, but to use the parameter as a conditional input to control the sorting logic for a large dataset. The sorting is applied to the data records, not the parameter. The core of our report architecture is as follows: Our main report is designed to call the Process_Info SQL stored procedure only once. This single call retrieves all the necessary data for three separate subreports. Each subreport requires a different sorting order for its specific business logic: Subreport 1: Requires chronological sorting (Chrono_DT). Subreport 2: Requires sorting by batch number (Batch_Number). Subreport 3: Requires sorting by a third unique key. The performance benefit is clear: Current, inefficient method: Each subreport connects to the database and calls the Process_Info stored procedure separately, resulting in three redundant database calls and slow execution. Desired, efficient method: The main report makes one call to the stored procedure. The dataset is cached, and each subreport accesses this cached data, applying its unique sorting without a new database call. The issue is that when a parameter is linked from the main report to a subreport, it is not available in the subreport's Group Expert to serve as the conditional variable for dynamic sorting. Our request is for a reliable method to use a linked variable or field to control the subreport's sorting on its cached data. This is a fundamental requirement for optimizing report performance by reducing database round-trips.

entry.title: Re: Sales based contract difference variable amount post...
entry.content: Use a Separate Condition for Variable Rent and define a non-valuation-relevant condition for variable rent (e.g., ZVAR). Configure it to calculate only the excess over the fixed rent threshold. This may require a custom calculation formula or enhancement via BAdI RECD_COND_CALC. You can store the threshold (₹10,000) as a reference value in the condition master or contract parameters. Use it in your calculation logic to compare against actual sales-based rent. With the BAdI suggested above, override standard percentage-based calculation. Continue posting actual sales via RE-FX sales interface or manual entry. This triggers the variable rent calculation each month.

entry.title: Re: Field InventoryStockType cannot be set for this opera...
entry.content:
From your Payload details, below are the Key observations

  • InventoryStockType = "02" → This refers to Quality Inspection stock.
  • StorageLocation = "" → No storage location provided.
  • GoodsMovementType = "101" → Standard GR for production or purchase.
  • Batch and Manufacturing Order are provided → Suggests GR against production order.

Please note even for QI stock, Storage Location is mandatory in most scenarios. SAP needs to know where to place the stock physically, even if it's under inspection. For QI stock to be posted, the Inspection Type (e.g., 01 for GR) must be active in the Material Master (QM view). Check if the material 000000000000001594 has an inspection type assigned for plant 02BP. Custom fields like YY1_Chilled_Exp_Date_MMI and YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI may have validation logic. Ensure /Date(0)/ for frozen expiry isn’t causing a rejection. Sticker number format of "55528-[]" might be failing validation if the system expects a specific format.

In order to fix this,

  • add a valid storage location in the payload for plant 02BP.
  • Go to material master QM View for material 1594 in plant 02BP. Ensure Inspection Type 01 is active and properly configured.
  • Ensure all custom date fields are valid and not defaulted to zero. If YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI is not applicable, consider omitting it or using a valid date.
  • If 55528-[] is not accepted, try a clean format like 55528 or 55528-01

entry.title: Re: I cant access to the cases
entry.content:
Dear User,

yesterday we had a general Access issue on SAP for Me which has been solved later at that day.

In general

To view or create support cases, your S-user ID must have specific permissions:

  • Display Cases
  • Display All Cases
  • Report Technical Problem
  • Send Cases to SAP
  • Close Cases
  • Display Cloud Data (for cloud-related cases)

These permissions must be granted by your company’s Super Administrator 

Please check if you have the required authorizations are assigned.  You can verify this in SAP for Me under: "My Profile" → "Authorizations".

If this works fine you might also check Browser Cache

Sometimes, access problems are caused by:

  • Browser cache or cookies
  • Ad blockers or extensions interfering with the portal

Try:

  • Clearing your browser cache
  • Using a different browser (e.g., Chrome, Edge)
  • Opening SAP for Me in incognito/private mode

If this isn't solving the issue it might be necessary to open a case on SAP for Me Product in the Get Support App and report adding:

  • Your User ID
  • Any error might occur

Thank you and best wishes

SAP for Me Technical Support Team

entry.title: 智领未来：SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有云中的 AI 架构与构建模块解析
entry.content:
在日常工作中，客户和合作伙伴经常会问到SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有云到底有哪些 AI 功能？

之前也通过文章分别介绍了 SAP Joule、嵌入式 AI、情境处理（Situation Handling）等具体功能。而今天这篇博客，我想从另一个角度聊聊——也就是 ​​SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有云中的 AI 架构​​，以及构建起众多 AI 功能的​​核心模块​​，希望能帮助大家更系统地理解这些 AI 能力，以及 SAP 在 AI 功能开发上的重点方向。

SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有云版将 AI 深度嵌入核心业务流程中，通过一系列精心设计的 AI 构建模块，将“AI 视作新的用户界面”（AI is the new UI），致力于为用户带来更直观、高效和智能的工作体验。这些功能不仅简化日常操作、自动化复杂任务，还提供前瞻性的智能洞察，成为智慧企业的重要基石。

从应用层面上来看，我们把这些模块归纳的功能分为几大类：

  • 面向用户体验的 AI​​：内置搜索文本生成什么代码生成等增强用户体验的功能。
  • 面向互动的 AI​​：以 Joule 为入口的对话式 AI，查询处理数据等。
  • 面向自动化的 AI​​：系统可自动完成任务，诸如文档处理，AI agent等自主任务完成。
  • 面向洞察和决策的 AI​​：借助机器学习、情框管理引擎，生成式AI能力，预测预估需求、判断延迟付款或识别潜在风险，并为用户提供下一步最佳措施与智能建议，辅助制定更明智的决策。

下面，我会为您带来每一个模块的详细解析：

S/4HANA Public Cloud中的AI构建模块

 

1： User Experience 用户体验 （内嵌式 AI辅助功能)：优化系统交互，实现“AI 即新 UI”的愿景

这些 AI 能力直接嵌入在云 ERP 系统中，它们通过自然语言处理 (NLP)生成摘要和提供筛选等功能，使搜索和处理业务数据更加高效。

核心功能与技术：

  • 智能摘要 (Smart Summarization)：对基于 Fiori Elements 的业务对象进行智能摘要，涵盖 1000 多个应用程序。
  • 简易筛选 (Easy Filter)：允许用户通过自然语言描述所需数据来筛选列表报告，适用于超过 1100 份报告。
  • 企业搜索 (Enterprise Search)：支持用户使用自然语言进行企业搜索。

许可：这些功能均属于免费的基础 AI (Base AI)，无需购买AI Unit，并且在客户接受 SAP AI 条款后，由 SAP 激活：

2： Joule：SAP专属智能副驾： 快速获取信息，简化应用程序导航，直接管理业务数据

Joule 通过直观的对话方式来简化协作用户日常工作。作为云ERP中最重要的AI的模块，Joule支持越来越多的业务对象的查询，管理，目标是支持 80% 以上的最常用的任务和业务流程。另外客户也可以将Joule作为系统交互的入口，开发属于自己的业务技能和文档信息检索。

Joule 支持多种交互模式，使用户能够以自然语言与系统进行互动：

  • 信息型 (Informational)：Joule 提供简洁的帮助内容摘要，有效回答用户的自然语言问题。例如，您可以询问“什么是无费用销售订单？”或“如何配置采购订单的灵活工作流？”。
  • 导航型 (Navigational)：Joule 推荐相关应用程序，并促进无缝导航，帮助用户执行业务流程。SAP Cloud ERP 中有超过 500 个导航场景，例如“我在哪个应用程序中可以看到采购订单？”。
  • 事务型 (Transactional)：Joule 提供关于业务对象的深入信息，无需打开相应的应用程序。用户可以直接在对话中查看和操作业务对象，SAP Cloud ERP 中有超过 45 个事务场景。例如，您可以直接询问“显示发货方为 Intelli Corp 的销售订单”。它还支持创建洞察卡、检查销售订单状态、续订过期价格和查看情境等功能。
  • 分析型 (Analytical) ：未来，用户将能够提出分析性问题，Joule 将利用 SAP Analytics Cloud 中的 JustAsk 提供分析洞察。

许可： 截止2508中提供的Joule 功能均已包含在基础 AI (Base AI)中，一次开通便可开始免费使用，无需额外购买AI unit。

3： Agents 代理：自动化复杂任务

作为未来发展的重点，代理技术旨在自动化许多曾经需要人工完成的复杂任务。它们不仅仅是能回答问题，更能​​主动规划并执行任务，它们通常是事件驱动和以实现最终任务为目标导向的。

业务示例： 会计应计 (Accounting Accruals) 和国际贸易分类 (Int. Trade Classification)，未来还将包括生产计划员。

目前AI agent还在开发中，您可以关注SAP的产品路线图查看最新的发布时间。

4： Intelligent Insights 智能洞察：提供数据驱动的建议

此构建模块通过生成式AI技术，利用企业的数据资产，提供针对数据的洞察和解析，智能推荐并提供行动建议。

业务示例： 成本中心财务业务洞察 (FBI for Cost Centers) 和集团财务报表财务业务洞察 (FBI for Group Financial Statement)。

许可，智能洞察功能需要购买SAP AI Unit后订阅高级 AI (Premium AI)  功能使用。

5： Document Processing 文档处理：从非结构化数据中提取价值

这个模块专注于从非结构化文档（如 PDF 或 JPG 格式的文件）中提取信息并自动化相关流程。此模块的功能利用SAP BTP中的文档处理服务（SAP Document AI）对于非机构化业务数据进行提取，并进行下一步流程。

核心功能：

  • 销售订单提取 (Sales Order extraction)：能够自动从 PDF 或图像格式的采购订单文件中创建销售订单。这是一个 机器学习基础 AI 场景 (Scope Item 4X9)，无需额外许可证。
  • 质量证书 (Quality certificates)管理：自动化处理传入的质量证书，提取相关信息。通过 SAP Document AI 处理质量证书属于 高级 AI (Premium AI) 功能，需要订购AI unit后开通使用。

6：Intelligent Communication 智能通信：解读交流，自动化流程

旨在从邮件、聊天、电话或文字记录中摘要、分类、提取和验证信息，并自动化相关流程。

业务示例： 争议管理 (Dispute Management)、分类 (Classification)、回归 (Regression) 和聚类/模式识别 (Clustering / pattern recognition)。

7：Machine Learning 机器学习：预测与优化

此构建模块利用企业的数据资产，并对结构化数据应用机器学习算法。

核心功能：

  • 销售绩效预测 (Sales Performance Prediction) 和 预测交付延迟 (Predicted Delivery Delay)。
  • 销售订单自动完成 (Sales Order Auto Completion)：为销售文档中缺失的数据提供建议，加快销售订单和客户退货订单的文档完成。这属于 机器学习基础 AI 场景 (Scope Item 73P)，无需额外许可证。

8：Pro-Active ERP主动式ERP 情境处理：防患于未然

此模块旨在通知业务专家潜在问题，并提出建议和行动，以避免未被发现的业务问题可能造成的严重后果。

核心功能与技术：

  • 情况处理 Situation Handling：自动检测关键业务问题，并通知相关用户。它可以在 SAP Fiori 启动板、电子邮件或 SAP Mobile Start 中提醒用户，并在应用程序中显示情况信息，提供上下文信息以支持知情决策。情境处理已在 SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 中开箱即用，无需额外操作。它还能利用生成式 AI (GenAI) 提供定制的解决方案建议（测试版功能）。

 

通过这些多样化的 AI 构建模块，SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有云版不仅提供了强大的智能能力，还在“基础 AI (Base AI)”和“高级 AI (Premium AI)”两种商业化模式下，帮助企业员工更智能、更高效地完成工作，真正实现数字化转型中的“智慧企业”愿景。

有关BASE AI开通指南，请浏览：

即刻免费解锁：SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 基础 AI 包 (B... - SAP Community

entry.title: Driving Promotion Excellence: Streamlined Creation and Copying with SAP Revenue Growth Management
entry.content:
1. Navigating Promotion Challenges 

Within the ever-evolving consumer products industry, Key Account Managers (KAMs) face relentless pressure to plan and execute promotions that both meet ambitious sales targets and strengthen customer relationships. Yet, many KAMs wrestle with cumbersome, fragmented tools—ranging from complex legacy systems to basic spreadsheets—that slow down promotion management and consume valuable time that could be spent building customer relationships and driving strategic growth. 

 

2. End-to-End Promotion Management Made Simple with SAP Revenue Growth Management 

SAP Revenue Growth Management (REVENUE GROWTH MANAGEMENT) resolves these challenges by delivering an integrated platform designed for KAMs to plan, create, and manage promotions more efficiently and transparently. Built specifically for the consumer products industry, SAP Revenue Growth Management centralizes promotion planning while enabling seamless integration with financial execution and demand planning systems, giving KAMs the visibility and agility they need to optimize promotion management and accelerate revenue growth.  

For more information on our current capabilities, see An Overview of SAP Revenue Growth Management.  

 

3. Four Key Strengths of Promotion Capabilities in SAP Revenue Growth Management 

3.1. Streamlined and Configurable Promotion Creation   

Promotion creation is made effortless within SAP Revenue Growth Management. 

  • Effective Promotion Creation

Unlike complex trade promotion management systems that require extensive configuration, SAP Revenue Growth Management guides users through promotion creation step by step — from defining promotion basics and product groups to trade spends and volume specifics. 

  • Adaptable to Your Business

KAMs can manage short-term and long-term promotions of products and categories with flexible spend types. Multiple spend types can be selected within a single promotion, all configurable to fit your unique business requirements. Promotions can also be saved as drafts, enabling collaboration with customers before finalization. 

 

This streamlined yet configurable promotion creation enables KAMs to spend more time engaging customers and optimizing trade strategies, rather than wrestling with spreadsheets or complicated software. 

 

 

3.2. Intuitive Promotion Copying and Editing: Aligned with KAM Workflows  

KAMs can benefit from a simple, user-friendly experience that takes just a few clicks to copy promotions. 

  • Intuitive Workflow to Copy and Adjust

KAMs can quickly copy promotions, singularly or using a multi-promotion selection from existing account plans and then adapt them to new contexts by editing various fields—such as editing products, dates, or trade spends—without losing the underlying structures. This approach mirrors KAMs' real-world habits, such as adjusting a 2025 holiday promotion for 2026. It not only significantly speeds up campaign rollout but also supports rapid scaling, re-use and adaptation of successful promotions. How can KAMs tell which promotions are the most successful – the embedded analytics in SAP Revenue Growth Management enable KAM’s to see performance KPI’s for individual promotions within their accounts.  

  • Flexible On-the-Fly Edits

A planned enhancement in Q1, 2026 will allow direct edits to copied promotions within the workflow UI, eliminating time-consuming navigation. KAMs will be able to make immediate tweaks to elements like trade spend types, reducing steps and boosting planning agility. 

 

By aligning with real-world KAM workflows and continuously evolving the user experience, SAP Revenue Growth Management supports both current needs and future efficiency gains.  

 

3.3. Customizable Approval Flows: Balancing Governance and Agility  

Promotion approvals can be a significant bottleneck, especially in organizations with layered hierarchies or robust financial controls. SAP Revenue Growth Management leverages SAP Business Process Automation (BPA) to create approval flows that can be tailored precisely: 

  • Flexible, Value-Based Rules

Approval workflows can be customized to your organizational requirements. For example, implement automatic approval for promotions below a certain threshold (e.g., $100K), allowing smaller promotions to proceed swiftly while routing higher-value ones for additional review. KAMs can add comments when sending promotions for review.  

  • Balancing Compliance and Operational Efficiency

This process integrates key roles such as KAMs, sales managers, and trade finance teams into a streamlined, transparent workflow. It strikes a balance between governance and agility, enabling KAMs to submit plans with confidence while ensuring stakeholders are engaged appropriately.  

 

4. Co-Innovation: Driving Promotion Excellence Together 

SAP Revenue Growth Management is evolving, and we invite forward-thinking users like you to join our co-innovation. 

Collaborate with us on these initiatives—and bring your ideas to life. 

  • Overlapping Promotions: Enable the creation of more than one promotion for the same products within the same or overlapping periods. 
  • Sell-Out Promotions Planning: Plan promotions that focus on creating consumer demand and drive products from retailers' shelves to end consumers. 
  • Planning with Multiple Units of Measure (UoMs): Plan promotions with different units of measure for products and visualize their impact on KPIs. 

Contact RGM_Engage@sap.com today to collaborate and keep your competitive edge in the consumer products market. 

 

More Information

Documentation on SAP Help Portal

Topic Page for SAP Revenue Growth Management

  • Unlocking Trade Spend Control Efficiency with Funds Management in SAP Revenue Growth Management
  • Decoding Promotional Success: Embedded Analytics in SAP Revenue Growth Management
  • Introducing Calendar View in SAP Revenue Growth Management: A Visual Leap for Strategic Planning
  • Consolidating Customer Planning: Unleash Growth with SAP Revenue Growth Management’s Account Plan
  • Elevate Your Promotion Strategy: Baseline Management with SAP Revenue Growth Management 
  • Driving Promotion Excellence: Streamlined Creation and Copying with SAP Revenue Growth Management

entry.title: Lessons Learned: Fetching Learning History from SuccessFactors LMS Using OData APIs
entry.content:
Introduction

When integrating SAP SuccessFactors LMS (Learning Management System) with downstream systems, one common requirement is to extract Learning History data — i.e., the courses a user has completed.

In this blogpost, I’ll share my journey of exploring the OData V4 APIs provided by SuccessFactors LMS, the challenges I faced, and how I managed to make it work with SAP Cloud Integration (CPI).

This article is especially useful if you are:

  • Trying to pull learning history records from LMS

  • Wondering why your API calls return errors like “missing search criteria filter information”

  • Looking for ready-to-use Groovy code to loop through users in CPI

Exploring the LMS OData V4 APIs

The base metadata endpoint looks like this:

https://<tenant>.lms.hr.cloud.sap/learning/odatav4/public/user/userlearning-service/v1/$metadata

From the metadata, we can see entity sets like LearningHistories and learninghistorys.

👉 A valid API call to fetch a user’s learning history looks like this:

GET https://<tenant>.lms.hr.cloud.sap/learning/odatav4/public/user/learningHistory/v1/learninghistorys?
$filter=criteria/targetUserID eq 'STUDENT001'

And the response returns details such as:

  • componentID → Course ID

  • title → Course Title

  • completionDate → Date Completed

  • status → Completion Status

Challenges I Faced

During implementation, several challenges came up:

  1. Malformed URI errors — caused by wrong resource paths in the CPI SuccessFactors adapter.

  2. 404 Not Found — when calling invalid entity sets (e.g., /LearningEvent is not supported in V4).

  3. “Missing search criteria filter information” — occurs if you don’t pass criteria/targetUserID.

  4. Single-user limitation — the API requires a targetUserID for every call, so bulk retrieval is not supported directly.

These were showstoppers until we aligned on the correct way to filter.

Solution: Fetching Learning History

✅ The working query pattern is:

/learning/odatav4/public/user/learningHistory/v1/learninghistorys?
$filter=criteria/targetUserID eq 'STUDENT001'

This means:

  • We must pass a user ID (student ID) every time.

  • To fetch data for multiple users, we need to loop through the list of student IDs.

Building It in SAP CPI

Here’s how you can design the iFlow:

  1. Get list of users – call /Students API or have a predefined list.

  2. Loop through users – in CPI, use a Splitter or Groovy script.

  3. Call LearningHistory API – pass each student ID dynamically.

  4. Collect responses – aggregate all learning history data.

  5. Filter & send downstream – only send completed courses or specific items (e.g., MAIR Code of Conduct).

Groovy Snippet: Looping Through Student IDs

Here’s a ready-to-use script you can copy-paste into CPI.

 

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
import groovy.json.*
import java.net.*
import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets

Message processData(Message message) {

    // 1. List of Student IDs (replace with dynamic input if needed)
    def studentIds = ["STUDENT001", "STUDENT002", "STUDENT003"]

    // 2. LMS LearningHistory API base URL
    def baseUrl = "https://<yourtenant>.lms.hr.cloud.sap/learning/odatav4/public/user/learningHistory/v1/learninghistorys"

    // 3. Get OAuth token from exchange property (set earlier in the flow)
    def accessToken = message.getProperty("OAuthToken")
    if (!accessToken) {
        throw new Exception("OAuth token not found. Please configure security flow correctly.")
    }

    def results = []

    studentIds.each { studentId ->
        try {
            // Build URL with criteria filter
            def query = "?$filter=" + URLEncoder.encode("criteria/targetUserID eq '${studentId}'", StandardCharsets.UTF_8.toString())
            def url = new URL(baseUrl + query)

            def connection = (HttpURLConnection) url.openConnection()
            connection.setRequestMethod("GET")
            connection.setRequestProperty("Authorization", "Bearer " + accessToken)
            connection.setRequestProperty("Accept", "application/json")

            def responseText = connection.inputStream.getText("UTF-8")
            def responseJson = new JsonSlurper().parseText(responseText)

            results.add([studentId: studentId, records: responseJson.value])

            connection.disconnect()
        } catch (Exception e) {
            results.add([studentId: studentId, error: e.message])
        }
    }

    // Return consolidated result
    message.setBody(JsonOutput.prettyPrint(JsonOutput.toJson(results)))
    return message
}

✅ Example Output

 

[
  {
    "studentId": "STUDENT001",
    "records": [
      { "componentID": "COURSE101", "title": "Data Privacy", "status": "Complete" }
    ]
  },
  {
    "studentId": "STUDENT002",
    "records": []
  }
]

Key Learnings

  • The LearningHistory API works only when you pass criteria/targetUserID.

  • Bulk extraction is not supported directly — looping is required.

  • You can optimize with CPI Splitter/Multicast for larger user volumes.

  • Always check the $metadata endpoint to confirm entity names before calling.

References That Helped

  1. SuccessFactors Integrations Beginner’s Guide: Exploring Learning Management
    (Official SAP blogpost explaining LMS OData services in detail)

  2. How to Integrate SuccessFactors LMS Module using Oracle Integration Cloud
    (A community blog showing similar challenges when integrating LMS APIs with another middleware)

These reinforced the idea that while LMS OData APIs are powerful, they also come with design constraints that integrators must handle.

Conclusion

Fetching Learning History from SuccessFactors LMS is possible via OData APIs, but you need to understand the mandatory filter requirements and handle the per-user limitation with looping.

With the right design in SAP CPI — and a bit of Groovy scripting — you can build a robust integration that delivers exactly what business needs.

entry.title: Re: Multiple Stock overview custom field
entry.content:
Your post is not clear to understand your requirement clearly. Please answer the following:

  • Which app or transaction are you referring to? Is it MD04, CO09, or a Fiori stock overview app?
  • What exactly do you want to see? Do you want to display the Customer Name next to the Sales Order in the stock overview? Or are you trying to filter stock by customer?
  • Is this for display only or reporting purposes? Do you want this in a UI screen, or are you building a custom report or CDS view?

For information, if you want to show Customer Name in stock overview (e.g., MD04 or Fiori app), the standard system doesn’t support this directly. You can achieve it by extending the app using Custom Fields and Logic (Key User Extensibility), Creating a Custom CDS View that joins Sales Order → Customer and Stock Overview → Sales Order. Building a Custom Analytical App or Report to show stock by customer

entry.title: Re: Need Help
entry.content:
Leverage Key User Extensibility to add a custom field for Actual Weight at the delivery item level or billing item level. This field can be populated by your macro or via API integration from the warehouse system.

If the macro recalculates weights and quantities, use BAdI SD_DELIVERY_ITEM_MODIFY or API /API_OUTBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV to update the delivery item quantities or weights. Ensure the adjusted weights are stored in a field that can be used in invoice output.

Modify the billing document output form to display the actual weight per item and show the total actual pallet weight. Use the custom field or adjusted delivery data as the source.

If your macro runs outside SAP (e.g., Excel or MES), consider building a middleware integration to push adjusted weights into SAP. Or use SAP AppGyver / UI5 app to allow warehouse users to enter actual weights directly.

entry.title: Re: How to add new applications for users
entry.content:
Dear customer,

Thanks for reaching out.

Regarding assigning new applications after upgrades to CB users, please kindly refer to below steps.

Firstly, you can check for the Business Catalog(s) for the required applications in Fiori Apps Library:

  1. Login Fiori Apps Library.
  2. Select All apps for SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.
  3. Click All Apps.
  4. Input the required application name in search bar.
  5. Select the searched out application name.
  6. Navigate to IMPLEMENTATION INFORMATION tab.
  7. Open Configuration subtab, under Business Catalog(s) you can see the Business Catalog(s) for the application.

After checked the Business Catalogs for the required applications, you can add these Business Catalogs to a Business Role that is assigned to the CB user to whom you would like he/she to see the applications in system,  and then the user can access to the required applications.

Hope this helps clarify the issue.

Best regards,

Jannie

entry.title: RPCNETN0 page down button not working in subscreen
